intro: Quercus abendanonii, commonly known as the Abendanona oak, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiraled acorns and leathery, dark green leaves. The plant thrives in the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat, showing adaptations to conserve water. Its ecological significance is notable in the local ecosystem, where it provides habitat and food for various endemic species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered vulnerable to extinction.
